author: cschoett
msg: Applied the patch from Drew (Thanks!) for Jira-1018, add a setConnection API to the JDBC Control.  The new api works as follows:
- If the JDBC control has already acquired a connection, setConnection will cause that connection to be closed.
- A connection set via setControl() will NOT be closed by the JDBC control
- If the JDBC control already has a connection supplied via the setConnection() api and setConnection() is invoked again,
- If setConnection() is invoked with a null parameter value, the JDBC control will return to its default behavior for acquiring and releasing connections.

- It is no longer an error to define a JDBC control without a ConnectionDriver or ConnectionDataSource annotation.  The setConnection() api must be used to establish a connection before invoking any JDBC control methods which require a connection.
